tune.name: Waltz for J. I
tune.author: Nicolas “Niols” Jeannerod
tune.content:
\transpose a, d {
  \relative f' {
    <<
      {
        \clef treble
        \key a \major
        \time 3/4

        \partial 2 e4 d |
        cis4. b8 a4 |
        a b cis |
        b cis d |
        b2 b8 a |
        gis4. fis8 e4 |
        gis a b |
        b cis dis |
        e
        \bar "||" \break

        e4 d |
        cis4. b8 a4 |
        a b cis |
        b cis d |
        b2 b8 a |
        gis4. fis8 e4 |
        cis' cis b |
        a2. |
        a4
        \bar "||" \break

        a4 gis |
        fis a cis |
        fis cis fis |
        d2 cis4 |
        b2 b4 |
        b d fis |
        b fis b |
        gis2 fis4 |
        e4
        \bar "||" \break

        fis4 gis |
        a4. b8 a4 |
        gis4. a8 gis4 |
        fis gis a |
        e2 d4 |
        cis4. b8 a4 |
        cis cis b |
        a2. a4
        \bar "|."
      }

      \new ChordNames {
        \chordmode {
          s2 |
          a2. | a/e | b:m | b:m/fis | e | e/gis | b:7 | e4:7
          s2 |
          a2. | a/e | b:m | b:m/fis | e | e:7 | d/a | a4

          s4 cis:m/gis |
          fis2.:m | fis:m/cis | b:m | b:m/fis | b:m | b:m/fis | e:7 | e4:7
          s2 |
          a2. | e | d | a/cis | a | e:7 | d/a | a4
        }
      }
    >>
  }
}
